answers.answer: This is a question for your doctor to answer... we are knowledgeable about diabetes, but not about other medical issues on this forum. Blood cell counts aren't typical issues that come up in discussing diabetes, so I plead ignorance. But here are some websites that have some good information for you:Info about the normal levels of white and red blood cells (you seem to fall in the normal range for both) --http://www.medicinenet.com/complete_blood_count/article.htmLymphocytes --http://www.medfriendly.com/lymphocyte.html#lowHope this helps! If you are concerned, call your doctor and ask some questions.

question: im am 35 years of age, my white blood cells are 9.9 and my red blood cells are 4.74.  my lymphs where 13.8 which is below average.  what does this mean and is there anything to be concerned about?
title: blood issues
